resources.string: 2 types of consciousness rooted in anger

INCLUDED IN A COMBINATION WITH 20 CHETASIKAs: 

 UNIVERSAL:
 >> 1. Contact (Phassa) 
 >> 2. Feeling (Vedanā) 
 >> 3. Perception (Saññā) 
 >> 4. Volition (Cetana) 
 >> 5. One-pointedness (Ekaggatā) 
 >> 6. Management life-ability (Jīvitindriya) 
 >> 7. Attention (Manasikāra) 

 HAPPENING FROM TIME TO TIME: 
 >> 8. Starter application (Vitakka) 
 >> 9. Sustainable application (Vicāra) 
 >> 10. Determination (Adhimokkha) 
 >> 11. Energy (Viriya) 
 >> 12. Desire to act (Chanda) 

 UNIVERSAL UNBENEFITABLE: 
 >> 13. Misconception (Moha) 
 >> 14. Shamelessness (Ahirika) 
 >> 15. Fearlessness of evil deeds (Anottappa) 
 >> 16. Anxiety (Uddhacca) 

 ADVERSE THINGS THAT HAPPEN FROM TIME TO TIME: 
 >> 17. Anger (Dosa) 
 >> 18. Envy (Issā) 
 >> 19. Stinginess (Macchariya) 
 >> 20. Excitement (Kukkucca)

EXAMPLE: Out of spite, one person kills another in a spontaneous fit of rage.
EXAMPLE: Out of malice, one person kills another after deliberation.

1 
 One consciousness, accompanied by dissatisfaction, associated with disgust, without motivation. 
 
 Domanassasahagatam patighasampayuttam asankharikam ekam.

2 
 One consciousness, accompanied by dissatisfaction, associated with disgust, with motivation. 
 
 Domanassasahagatam patighasampayuttam sasankhārikam ekan ti.
